title: Lemon Cupcake with Blackberry Buttercream Recipe
description: Simple made-from-scratch lemon cupcakes with blackberry buttercream frosting. These treats are a refreshing hit with bright, tart, and sweet flavors.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Fruit Desserts Lemon Dessert Recipes Lemon Cupcake with Blackberry Buttercream 4.5 (305) 251 Reviews 118 Photos This simple from-scratch lemon cupcake has a blackberry buttercream frosting. This dessert is a refreshing hit! Garnish each cupcake with a blackberry or a pinch of lemon zest. Submitted by Megan C A. Updated on March 19, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 118 118 118 118 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 24 Yield: 2 dozen cupcakes Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 24 servings 1 cup white sugar ½ cup butter 2 eggs 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour 1 ¾ teaspoons baking powder ½ cup low-fat milk 1 lemon, juice and zest 1 cup butter, softened 1 teaspoon vanilla extract ¼ teaspoon salt 4 cups confectioners' sugar ½ cup seedless blackberry jam Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 24 muffin cups with paper liners. Cream sugar and 1/2 cup butter in the bowl of a stand mixer until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, and mix 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla into mixture with the second egg. Beat in flour and baking powder until thoroughly combined; beat in milk, lemon juice, and lemon zest to make a smooth batter. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups. Bake in the preheated oven until cupcake edges are slightly golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool cupcakes completely. To make frosting: Beat 1 cup butter with 1 teaspoon vanilla and salt until smooth and creamy. Beat in confectioners' sugar, 1 cup at a time, to make a creamy frosting. Beat in blackberry jam. Spread frosting on cooled cupcakes. I Made It Print 584 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 272 Calories 12g Fat 41g Carbs 2g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 24 Calories 272 % Daily Value * Total Fat 12g 16% Saturated Fat 8g 38% Cholesterol 46mg 15% Sodium 151mg 7% Total Carbohydrate 41g 15% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 33g Protein 2g 3% Vitamin C 4mg 4% Calcium 36mg 3% Iron 1mg 3% Potassium 34mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Lemon Cupcake with Blackberry Buttercream 01 of 118 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 118 Photo by  TSS 02/07/2021 03 of 118 Photo by  Rebecca Ann Hausleben 07/26/2020 The cupcakes turned out very dense almost like a cheesecake. Icing made too much so I had a lot left over. The jam didn’t really taste like blackberries more like grape jelly. Not much flavor to it also. Though, the lemon flavor was good! Turned out pretty in the end. 04 of 118 Photo by  Kimberly Anne 05/16/2020 05 of 118 Photo by  Cody Burdette 04/16/2020 06 of 118 Photo by  samantha rivera 01/27/2020 Such a unique recipe! I forgot baking powder and they were still awesome. Cut frosting recipe in half, as others have said. Also add 50% more milk. I'm making another batch soon and will probably double the amount of lemon. I also think the frosting, depending on your preferences, could have more blackberry jam added to make it a little fruitier. YUM! 07 of 118 Photo by  Lidija Nyman 08/16/2019 I used a cup of milk instead of half a cup (as suggested by the comments) and they came out very light and fluffy!!! I also added probably a cup of blackberry jam instead—I measured out half a cup and then dumped in more till it was to a taste I liked. I found that with just the half a cup, it kind of just dyed the frosting instead of flavoring it, and even with the amount I put in, the taste was still overwhelmingly buttercream and not blackberry (which is what I was more going for). However, my friends mom almost cried when tasting it from how good they were, so DEFINITELY a major recommendation from me! 08 of 118 Photo by  Jaime Paugh 06/16/2019 Super easy and extremely tasty!! I took this to work to test out on co-workers before I made it for my parent’s party in a couple of weeks. It was a winner. Lemony but not too much. Just perfect and the frosting was to die for! 09 of 118 Photo by  Destiny Swygard 05/11/2019 10 of 118 Photo by  Becky Pierce 04/25/2019 Delicious cupcakes! I would definitely make again 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Lemon-Blueberry Cupcakes with Blueberry-Lemon Buttercream Frosting 6 Ratings Gingerbread Cupcakes with Cream Cheese Frosting 149 Ratings Raspberry White Chocolate Buttercream Cupcakes 46 Ratings Carrot Cupcakes with White Chocolate Cream Cheese Icing 561 Ratings Strawberry-Chocolate Mini Cupcakes with White Chocolate Ganache 6 Ratings Strawberry Cupcakes with Lemon Zest Cream Cheese Icing 28 Ratings Mini Lemon Mascarpone Cheesecakes 2 Ratings Christmas Santa Cupcakes 4 Ratings Cinco de Chili Chocolate Cupcakes with Chili Cream Cheese Frosting 120 Ratings Lemon Meringue Cupcakes 1 Rating Best Carrot Cake Cupcakes 27 Ratings Lemon Cupcakes with Lemon Frosting 18 Ratings Raspberry-Lemon Cupcakes 2 Ratings Lemon-Filled Cupcakes 17 Ratings Strawberry Lemonade Cupcakes 2 Ratings Chocolate Cupcakes with Cream Cheese-Oreo-Buttercream Frosting 8 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Megan C A.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 24 muffin cups with paper liners.;Cream sugar and 1/2 cup butter in the bowl of a stand mixer until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, and mix 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla into mixture with the second egg.;Beat in flour and baking powder until thoroughly combined; beat in milk, lemon juice, and lemon zest to make a smooth batter.;Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups.;Bake in the preheated oven until cupcake edges are slightly golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool cupcakes completely.;To make frosting: Beat 1 cup butter with 1 teaspoon vanilla and salt until smooth and creamy. Beat in confectioners' sugar, 1 cup at a time, to make a creamy frosting. Beat in blackberry jam. Spread frosting on cooled cupcakes.
